fields.headline: Tales from the tabs
fields.bodyText: Bobby spree: Simao next Bobby Robson was last night close to another major deal two days after landing Lee Bowyer: Toon bosses have opened talks over a three-year contract offer for £10m Benfica winger Simao Sabrosa. 'English soccer very much attracts me,' says Simao, 23. 'Benfica have told me to say nothing, but Newcastle are good, and that pleases me.' Houll dumps Heskey Gerard Houllier is ready to dump Emile Heskey in an £18m plan to land Blackburn star Damien Duff. Houllier - already in talks to replace Heskey with Auxerre's £10m Djibril Cissé - plans a squad cull to raise extra cash: Berger, Babbel, Heggem, Xavier and Arphexad will all be released, and Dietmar Hamann and Vladimir Smicer sold. And the rest... Chelsea and Fulham have offered big money deals to Gabriel Batistuta (below). 'Gabriel has lots of fans,' says his agent. 'He's also wanted in Dubai, France and Qatar - but he wants England.' · Man United and Spurs are in for Montpellier starlet Bertand Robert. · Besiktas veteran Oscar Cordoba and Standard Liège star Fabian Carini say they're 'very flattered' to be touted as David Seaman replacements at Arsenal. · Leeds have told Man United and Liverpool to start the bidding at £10m for Harry Kewell. · Villa defender Olof Mellberg says he fancies a move to Arsenal: 'It's a big club - and one might be interested, hypothetically.' · Blackburn are preparing a deal for Millwall star Steven Reid. · Bolton say they'll listen to big offers for Jay-Jay Okocha: 'If someone offers £10m - every player has his price.' · Oleg Luzhny plans to snub Charlton to stay at Arsenal : 'Oleg wants to finish his career at Highbury,' says his agent. · Man City are in for Real's Steve McManaman, ex- Blackburn winger Keith Gillespie and Lens star Antoine Sibierski. · Brighton have told Spurs to pay big cash for striker Bobby Zamora. · Jason Koumas says he could quit West Brom : 'I love Albion to bits but I don't know where I'll be next season.' · Portsmouth have released eight more players. · And new Palace boss Steve Kember is in for Man City's Darren Huckerby. Win Premiership tickets Mobile operator 3, provider of Premiership goals to your 3 video mobile, are offering one Observer Sport reader three pairs of tickets to Premiership games of your choice next season. For a chance to win the lot, visit www.observer.co.uk/sport You can mail the Observer direct at sport@observer.co.uk
